ai-tha-ap441:1.2_0: As a mighty flood sweeps away a sleeping village,
ai-tha-ap441:1.4_0: I saw the benefit of the world,
ai-tha-ap441:2.1_0: after picking up a slope-flower tree,
ai-tha-ap441:3.1_0: when my mind is out of desire,
ai-tha-ap441:3.3_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
ai-tha-ap441:4.3_0: In this way he went back to the beginning.
ai-tha-ap441:6.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap441:6.2_0: I used to be a fruit.
ai-tha-ap441:6.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap441:8.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap441:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja.
ai-tha-ap441:11.1_0: and the ninth jungle thicket for the Elder Nuns.
